Clipped from: [https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm)

### 1891–1937

![Gramsci](data:image/png;base64,)

##### Notice to Readers

All the texts listed below have been published with the kind permission of the translator/copyright holder. However, [Lawrence & Wishart](mailto:sally@lwbooks.co.uk), who have published collections of translations by Quintin Hoare, the most prolific Gramsci translator, claim that [Hoare gave the MIA permission](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/hoare_permission_for_spn.txt) in contravention of his contract with them, and consequently, in January 2008, Lawrence & Wishart requested the M.I.A. to withdraw the Hoare translations. The Marxists Internet Archive always strives to work in a spirit of cooperation with publishers, so as a result, only those translations done by Mark Camilleri, [Mitchell Abidor](https://www.marxists.org/admin/volunteers/biographies/mabidor.htm), Natalie Campbell and Michael Carley under the [Creative Commons (Attribute & ShareAlike)](https://www.marxists.org/admin/legal/cc/by-sa.htm) licence, for marxists.org are provided below.  
 

#### Gramsci’s Life and Thought

Gramsci’s political and social writings occur in two periods, pre-prison (1910–1926) and prison (1929–35).  His pre-prison writings tend to be politically specific, while his prison writings tend to be more historical and theoretical.

For a brief overview of Gramsci’s life and thought see:

[An Introduction to Gramsci’s Life and Thought by Frank Rosengarten.](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/intro.htm) 

[Gramsci’s Arrest: Letter by Tania Schucht](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/schucht-letter.htm), November 1926

#### Pre-Prison Political Writings 1910–1926

1916

[Newspapers and the Workers](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/1916/12/newspapers.htm)[*](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm#note) (Avanti!, 22 December 1916)  
 [Men or machines?](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/1916/12/men_or_machines.htm) (Avanti!, 24 December)  
 

1917

[Character](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/1917/03/character.htm) [*](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm#note) (Grido del Popolo, 3 March 1917)  
 [Notes on The Russian Revolution](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm) (Grido del Popolo, 29 April)  
 [The Russian Maximalists](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm) (Grido del Popolo, 28 July)  
 [The Revolution Against ’Capital’](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/1917/12/revolution-against-capital.htm),[*](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm#note) (Avanti!, 24 November)  
 

1918

[One Year of History](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/1918/03/one-year.htm)[*](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm#note) (Grido del Popolo, 16 March 1918)  
 

1919

[Red Ink](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/1919/04/red-ink.htm) [*](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm#note) (Avanti!, 4 April 1919)  
 [The Price of History](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/1919/06/price-history.htm)[*](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm#note) (L’Ordine Nuovo, 7 June 1919)  
 [Workers’ democracy](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/1919/06/workers-democracy.htm)[*](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm#note) (L’Ordine Nuovo, 21 June 1919)  
 [The conquest of the state](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/1919/07/conquest-state.htm)[*](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm#note) (L’Ordine Nuovo, 12 July 1919)  
 [Workers and peasants](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/1919/08/workers-peasants.htm)[*](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm#note) (L’Ordine Nuovo, 2 August 1919)  
 [The development of the revolution](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/1919/09/development-revolution.htm)[*](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm#note) (L’Ordine Nuovo, 13 September 1919)  
 [Chronicles of the new order](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/1919/09/chronicles.htm)[*](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm#note) (L’Ordine Nuovo, 13 September 1919)  
 [To the section commissars of the FIAT-Brevetti workshops](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/1919/09/fiat.htm)[*](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm#note) (L’Ordine Nuovo, 13 September 1919)  
 [Unions and councils](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/1919/10/unions-councils.htm)[*](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm#note) (L’Ordine Nuovo, 11 October 1919)  
 [Unions and the dictatorship](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/1919/10/unions-dictatorship.htm)[*](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm#note) (L’Ordine Nuovo, 25 October 1919)  
 [Revolutionaries and elections](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/1919/11/elections.htm)[*](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm#note) (L’Ordine Nuovo, 15 November 1919)  
 [The problem of power](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/1919/11/problem-power.htm)[*](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm#note) (L’Ordine Nuovo, 29 November 1919)  
 [The events of 2–3 December (1919)](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/1919/12/events-december.htm)[*](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm#note) (L’Ordine Nuovo, 13 December 1919)  
 

1920

[Workers and peasants](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/1920/01/workers-peasants.htm), [*](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm#note) (L’Ordine Nuovo, 3 January 1920)  
 [Split or Disorder?](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/1920/12/split-disorder.htm) [*](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm#note) (L’Ordine Nuovo, December 11–18, 1920)

1925

 [Introduction to the First Course of the Party School](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/1925/05/intro_party_school.htm)[*](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm#note) [Speech to the Italian parliament](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/1925/05/speech.htm), 16 May 1925 [*](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm#note) [The Internal Situation in our Party and the Tasks of the Forthcoming Congress](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm) [Elements of the Situation](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm) [Maximalism and Extremism](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/1925/07/maximalism.htm) (L’Unità, July 2 1925) [*](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm#note) [Sterile and Negative Criticism](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/1925/09/sterile-negative.htm) (L’Unità September 30, 1925) [*](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm#note) [On the Operations of the Central Committee of the Party](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/1925/12/operations.htm) (L’Unità December 20, 1925) [*](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm#note) 

1926

[The Italian situation and the tasks of the PCI](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm) (Lyons, January 1926)  
 [The party’s first five years](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm) (L’Unita, 24 February 1926)  
 [A study of the Italian situation](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm) (Report to Party Executive Commitee, 2-3 August 1926.)  
 [The peasants and the dictatorship of the proletariat](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm) (L’Unità, 17 September 1926)  
 [Once again on the organic capacities of the working class](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm) (L’Unità, 1 October 1926)  
 [We and the Republican Concentration](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm) (L’Unità, 13 October 1926)  
 [Some aspects of the southern question](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm) (Unfinished, October 1926)  
 [Letter to Palmiro Togliatti](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/1926/10/letter-togliatti.htm) [*](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm#note), October 1926  
 

1928

[Letter to Tania Schucht](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/1928/new-year-letter.htm) 2 January 1928

[State and Civil Society](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/prison_notebooks/state_civil/index.htm)

[The Study of Philosophy](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/prison_notebooks/study_philosophy/index.htm) [Structure and Superstructure](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm) [i]  
 [Structure and Superstructure](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm) [ii]  
 [Structure and Superstructures](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm) [iii]  
 [The Concept of ‘Historical Bloc’](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm) [Ethico-Political History](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm) [Ethico-Political History and Hegemony](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm) [Political Ideologies](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm) [Ideologies](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm) [Validity of Ideologies](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm) [Analysis of Situations: Relations of Force](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm) [Some Theoretical and Practical Aspects of ‘Economism’](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm) [also in [The Modern Prince](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm)]  
 [Observations on Certain Aspects of the Structure of Political Parties in Periods of Organic Crisis](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm)

[War of Position and War of Manoeuvre](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm) [War of Position and War of Manoeuvre or Frontal War](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm) 

[Political Parties in Periods of Organic Crisis](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm) [Caesarism](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm) [The Fable of the Beaver](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm) [Agitation and Propaganda](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm) [The "Philosophy of the Epoch"](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm) 

[The Problem of Political Leadership in the Formation and Development of the Modern State in Italy](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm) [Rationalization of the Demographic Composition of Europe](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm) [Some Aspects of the Sexual Question](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm) [Financial Autarky and Industry](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm) [‘Animality’ and Industrialism](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm) [Rationalization of Production and Work](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm) [Taylorism and the Mechanization of the Worker](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm) 

[Philosophy: Some preliminary reference points](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/index.htm) 

#### Collections of Gramsci’s Writings

[Selections from Political Writings (1910-1920)](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/political-writings.htm), ISBN 1-84327-121-4, [The Electric Book Company](http://www.elecbook.com/) London 1999, selected, introduced and edited by Quentin Hoare and translated by John Mathews, transcribed from the edition published by © Lawrence and Wishart, London 1977.  
 [Selections from Political Writings (1921-1926)](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/spw2-contents.htm), translated and edited by © Quintin Hoare, published by Lawrence and Wishart, London 1978. ISBN 0-85315-420-1  
 [Selections from the Prison Notebooks](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/prison_notebooks/selections.htm), translated and edited © by Quintin Hoare and Geoffrey Nowell-Smith, 1971  
 [An Antonio Gramsci Reader: Selected Writings 1916-1935](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/prison_notebooks/reader/index.htm), edited by David Forgacs (© annotations and the selection), including translations from: Selections from Prison Notebooks (© Quintin Hoare and Geoffrey Nowell-Smith, 1971); from Selections from Political Writings (1910-1920) (© Lawrence and Wishart, 1977); from Selections from Political Writings (1921-1926) (© Quintin Hoare, 1978); from Selections from Cultural Writings (© Lawrence and Wishart, 1986), and previously unpubished material (© David Forgacs 1988 and © Lawrence and Wishart 1988)

With the Exact Phrase:

With at least one of words:

* Translated by Mark Camilleri for marxists.org.  
 * Translated by Mitchell Abidor for marxists.org.  
 * Translated by Michael Carley for marxists.org.  
 * Translated by Natalie Campbell for marxists.org.  
 * Translated by Ben W. for marxists.org.  
 Translations formerly found in this archive were by Quentin Hoare; all translations were used with permission of the translator who is also the holder of the rights in each case. However, Lawrence & Wishart have directed us to remove these translations from the site. See [Details of MIA Translators](https://www.marxists.org/archive/gramsci/translators.htm).

The entire Gramsci Archive was proofed and corrected by Kevin Goins in 2007.
